results.title: Swim and live
results.creator_credit: Syd Wood, Frank Killian and Movietone Productions
results.brief_description: Describes the progressive steps in learning to swim and how a life can be lost by not being able to swim. Illustrates different swimming styles and shows a championship swimming event. Features Olympic champion Murray Rose.

results.title: SWIFT website (22-05-2000)
results.brief_description: 1998 Project description: Cinemedia is currently developing a tailored solution for the storage and delivery of film and video titles in a digital environment. When SWIFT is operational, it will be used to provide online delivery of Cinemedia’s screen culture programs. It will also offer commercial digital management and delivery services to owners and users of audio-visual material.

results.title: Swift and sure
results.brief_description: This film shows some of the vast array of modern communication equipment and training of the Royal Australian Signals’ Personnel who operate and maintain it. A signal message from Papua is shown passing through various processes of transmission en route to Canberra.

results.title: Sweet sixteen and pregnant
results.creator_credit: John Cosgrove, Ann Hassett and Dave Bell Associates
results.brief_description: Provides case studies of teeage pregnancies looking at the outcome for each girl when it was discovered that she was pregnant. Considers adoption, abortion, keeping the child, and living with one’s family. Highlights the enormous stress of being a teenage mother and points out that girls should fight peer group pressure to have sexual relationships if they do not wish to do so.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Cosgrove, Ann Hassett and Dave Bell Associates

results.title: Swedish peasant paintings
results.brief_description: A study of the “gourd” paintings done by the itinerant peasant artists who flourished in the Dalecarlia district of Sweden in the eighteenth century. The scenes usually have a religious content, although floral motifs are frequently used. The diea of the gourd as the symbol of life is taken from the Book of Jonah and recurs throughout these domestic paintings.

results.title: Swedish cinema classics
results.creator_credit: Gardar Sahlberg, Svensk Filmindustri and Swedish Institute

results.title: Sweden is horrible
results.creator_credit: Karsten Wedel, Radio Sweden and Wedel Films
results.brief_description: Swedish “sin” is better known throughout the world than Swedish steel, to judge by the interest shown by many foreign publications. This film will either help to confirm preconceived notions on this subject or, perhaps, give you ideas about greater sexual equality.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karsten Wedel, Radio Sweden and Wedel Films
